General.Name: Gameflip
General.Description: Gameflip is marketplace where gamers can buy and sell digital goods. Established in 2014, Gameflip will now leverage blockchain technology to provide a transparent, safe, and frictionless infrastructure for buying and selling of digital goods among gamers, allowing them to own and securely store their digital goods on the blockchain. FLIP is an ERC20 token used as the main currency in the Gameflip platform.

ICO.Description:
Gameflip is marketplace where gamers can buy and sell digital goods. Established in 2014, Gameflip will now leverage blockchain technology to provide a transparent, safe, and frictionless infrastructure for buying and selling of digital goods among gamers, allowing them to own and securely store their digital goods on the blockchain. FLIP is an ERC20 token used as the main currency in the Gameflip platform.

Team:

  • JT Nguyen: Co-founder and CEO
  • Terry Ngo: Co-founder and CTO
  • Bryan Talbot: Head of Engineering
  • Matheus Arnellas: Head of Live Operations
  • Ed Kim: Head of Business Development
  • Udayan Sharma: Head of Marketing
  • Tony Simonovsky: ICO Success Manager

The Gameflip ICO is currently hosting its pre-sale which will end on the 27th of October. The FLIP main ICO will start on the 4th of December and will last until the 29th of January, 2018. The ICO token allocation represents 43.2% of the total FLIP supply. 

● Minimum amount per purchaser: 0.1 ETH 
● Goal for the main sale (soft cap): 6500 ETH 
● Maximum total number of tokens for the pre-sale and main sale (hard cap): 43,200,000. Unsold tokens at the end of the crowdsale will be burned. 
● The main sale will end at the earliest of the following events: (i) 72 hours after 30,000 ETH is achieved or (ii) 43,200,000 FLIP tokens are purchased or (iii) the end date of January 29th, 2018 at 19:00 UTC is reached. 

Token Reserve Split:

  • 43.2% Token sale,
  • 14% Company,
  • 40% Network growth,
  • 2.8% Advisors and Partners

The FLIP ICO features a bonus and bounty campaign.
